metadata.title: backgroundExtensionEffect() | Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Apple Developer Documentation page for the SwiftUI instance method backgroundExtensionEffect(), which adds a background extension effect to views by duplicating them into mirrored copies with blur effects. The documentation includes platform availability, method signature, discussion with code example, and usage notes.
metadata.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

content.note: Additional methods visible in sidebar from extracted text

content.text: Adds the background extension effect to the view. The view will be duplicated into mirrored copies which will be placed around the view on any edge with available safe area. Additionally, a blur effect will be applied on top to blur out the copies.

Use this modifier when you want to extend the view beyond its bounds so the copies can function as backgrounds for other elements on top. The most common use case is to apply this to a view in the detail column of a navigation split view so it can extend under the sidebar or inspector region to provide seamless immersive visuals.
Apply this modifier with discretion. This should often be used with only a single instance of background content with consideration of visual clarity and performance.

body.text: This modifier will clip the view to prevent copies from overlapping with each other.

content.text: To submit feedback on documentation, visit Feedback Assistant.
Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

pages.pageSummary: This page documents the SwiftUI instance method backgroundExtensionEffect() which adds a background extension effect to views. The method duplicates views into mirrored copies placed around edges with available safe area, with blur effects applied. It is available on iOS 26.0+, iPadOS 26.0+, Mac Catalyst 26.0+, macOS 26.0+, tvOS 26.0+, visionOS 26.0+, and watchOS 26.0+. The documentation includes a code example showing usage within NavigationSplitView with an inspector, and notes about discretionary use and automatic view clipping.

crossPageElements.runningFooters: Apple Footer with Platform Links and Copyright

sections.title: Method Declaration
sections.summary: Declaration section containing the method type, name, description, platform availability badges, and Swift function signature with attributes.

sections.title: Discussion
sections.summary: Discussion section explaining when to use the modifier, providing a NavigationSplitView code example, cautioning about discretionary use, and noting the automatic clipping behavior.

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The document follows Apple's standard API documentation format: it begins with navigation elements, then presents the method type and name as the main heading, followed by a brief description and platform availability. The method signature is shown in a code block. The Discussion section provides detailed usage guidance with a practical code example demonstrating integration with NavigationSplitView and inspector. A note callout highlights important technical behavior (view clipping). The page concludes with standard Apple footer elements including platform links, resources, and copyright information.

keyTerms.definition: A SwiftUI view modifier that duplicates a view into mirrored copies placed around edges with available safe area, with blur effects applied on top
A SwiftUI container that presents views in two or three columns for navigation purposes
The area of the screen that is not obscured by system UI elements like the sidebar or inspector
A Swift attribute that ensures the code runs on the main thread/actor
A Swift attribute for compatibility with code written before Swift concurrency was introduced
A trailing panel in NavigationSplitView that can show additional details or tools
A SwiftUI container that overlays its children on top of each other

keyFindings: backgroundExtensionEffect() is a new API available in iOS/iPadOS/macOS/tvOS/visionOS/watchOS 26.0+
The modifier creates mirrored copies of the view that extend into safe area edges
A blur effect is automatically applied on top of the mirrored copies
The most common use case is applying it to detail column views in NavigationSplitView
The modifier allows background content to extend seamlessly under sidebar and inspector regions
The modifier automatically clips views to prevent copy overlap
Should be used with discretion for visual clarity and performance reasons
Typically should be used with only a single instance of background content

designDecisions.rationale: To prevent mirrored copies from overlapping with each other
To visually distinguish the extended background from the main content and create a seamless immersive effect
For visual clarity and performance optimization

codeExamples.title: Method Signature
codeExamples.purpose: Shows the complete method signature with attributes
codeExamples.explanation: The method is marked with @MainActor to ensure main thread execution and @preconcurrency for compatibility. It returns an opaque View type.

codeExamples.title: NavigationSplitView Usage Example
codeExamples.purpose: Demonstrates applying the modifier to a view in the detail column of a NavigationSplitView with an inspector
codeExamples.explanation: The example shows a NavigationSplitView with a sidebar and detail column. Inside the detail column, a ZStack contains a BannerView with the backgroundExtensionEffect modifier applied. This allows the BannerView to extend its background under both the sidebar and the inspector panel for seamless immersive visuals. The inspector is conditionally presented based on the $showInspector binding.

components.name: ZStack
components.role: Container for layering the background extension effect

components.name: BannerView()
components.role: Custom view that provides the background content

components.name: .backgroundExtensionEffect()
components.role: Modifier that creates mirrored copies extending into safe areas

components.name: .inspector()
components.role: Trailing panel modifier for additional content
